overview_of_class:
This is the first quarter of the three-quarter sequence of Intermediate German. Its primary goal is the continued development of proficiency in all German language skills. We will read variety of texts focusing mainly on German history and culture in the 20th century. In each of the three courses in this sequence we focus on a different aspect of German culture and language.
Fall Quarter: literature, history and culture in the 20th century. Winter Quarter: colloquial and idiomatic contemporary language, contemporary German society and culture. Spring Quarter is devoted to excerpts from German literary works and media and discussion arising from them.
name: Intermediate German
title: WCAS GERMAN 102-1-20 Intermediate German
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: PRE-REG only: Reserved for German majors.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This is the first quarter of the three-quarter sequence of Intermediate German. Its primary goal is the continued development of proficiency in all German language skills. We will read variety of texts focusing mainly on German history and culture in the 20th century. In each of the three courses in this sequence we focus on a different aspect of German culture and language.
Fall Quarter: literature, history and culture in the 20th century. Winter Quarter: colloquial and idiomatic contemporary language, contemporary German society and culture. Spring Quarter is devoted to excerpts from German literary works and media and discussion arising from them.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: German 101-3 or equivalent

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Continued development of all language skills. The students will gain insight into contemporary Germany and perspective on German history. Students will increase their linguistic proficiency and their cultural literacy.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class participationDiscussionFilms / videosGroup workOnline workPresentationsReadingsWriting assignments

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Attendance: 10%
Class participation: 10%
Online work: 15%
Project, final: 15%
Quizzes: 50%

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: 1 course packets to be purchased at Quartet Copy at the beginning of the quarter.
